meanings.definition: Relating to an early stage of development or existence.
meanings.sent1: The cave paintings showed a primitive form of art.
meanings.sent2: The primitive tools were made from basic materials.
meanings.sent3: The primitive computer struggled to perform even simple tasks.
meanings.sent4: Her cooking skills were so primitive, it was like watching a caveman in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The primitive hut provided shelter but lacked modern comforts.

meanings.definition: Characterized by simplicity or lack of sophistication.
meanings.sent1: The primitive design of the house gave it a rustic charm.
meanings.sent2: His primitive manners made him endearing to everyone he met.
meanings.sent3: The primitive drawing looked like it was done by a child, but it was actually by a famous artist.
meanings.sent4: The primitive technology may seem outdated, but it gets the job done.
meanings.sent5: The primitive language was easy to learn due to its straightforward structure.

meanings.definition: A person belonging to a preliterate or nonindustrial society.
meanings.sent1: The anthropologist studied the primitive living habits of the tribe.
meanings.sent2: The primitive relied on hunting and gathering for survival.
meanings.sent3: The primitive in the story was depicted as wise and resourceful.
meanings.sent4: The explorer encountered a primitive deep in the jungle.
meanings.sent5: The primitive shared ancient stories around the campfire.
